meanings.definition: relating to or near the sun
meanings.sent1: The heliacal rays of the sun warmed the earth in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The heliacal heat made the day feel brighter and warmer.
meanings.sent3: The heliacal sun peeked over the horizon, greeting the world with its gentle light.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as heliacal as the sun, spreading warmth wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The heliacal glow of the sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: occurring or appearing near the sun
meanings.sent1: The heliacal planets were visible in the evening sky.
meanings.sent2: The heliacal moon shone brightly against the dark night.
meanings.sent3: The heliacal birds flew gracefully in the sky, silhouetted by the setting sun.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was as heliacal as the sun's rays, filling the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The heliacal glow of the streetlights guided her way home in the dusk.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the first appearance of a star in the morning sky, just before sunrise
meanings.sent1: The heliacal star twinkled faintly in the early morning sky.
meanings.sent2: The heliacal constellation marked the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The heliacal planets aligned perfectly, heralding a day full of possibilities.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as heliacal as the first bird's song at dawn, breaking the silence.
meanings.sent5: The heliacal beauty of the sunrise painted the world in golden hues.
